result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defense moves to enter a special plea of NGI and requests an NGI Evaluation under 971.16 be ordered.  Court Grants and order an NGI Evaluation under 971.16.  Court will Appoint Behavioral Consultants.   Evaluation to be filed by 11/23/22.

Court discontinues the plea colloquy to allow for the Defendant to stabilize on new medications.

records.addlTxt:
08:49 AM Defendant John J Gfesser in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court passes the case to allow the Defendant to fill out the Petition for Appointment of Attorney.
Defendant did not qualify for Public Defender representation.
09:06 AM The case is recalled with the same appearances.
Court swears in the Defendant and questions the Defendant regarding the Petition.
Court grants request, repayment at rate of $50.00 per month commencing 5/01/2022.  Hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

01:07 PM Defendant John J Gfesser in court, in custody, with attorney Steven Hughes, as a friend of the court.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
